value.string:
# This script is part of ERP5 Web
 #
 # ERP5 Web is an extension to ERP5 which provides a way
 # to create web sites which can display selected
 # ERP5 contents through multiple custom web layouts.
 #
 # This script returns the absolute URL of the current 
 # document in a pretty way and taking into account
 # virtual hosting. The purpose of this script is to be
 # able to access documents through a URL such as:
 #
 # www.mysite.com/mysection/a-document-reference
 #
 # even if the physical path of the document is
 #
 # /erp5/web_page_module/33
 #
 # The default script looks in the acquisition context
 # for the first relevant section and build a URL
 # based on the section absolute_url and on the 
 # document reference. 
 #
 # More sophisticated behaviours are possible.
 #
 # It may be useful to change the behaviour
 # of WebSite_getDocumentUrl for non anonymous
 # users or for documents which are not published.
 #
 # NOTE: it is still unknown whether this script
 # needs to be integrated or not to the absolute_url API
 
 # FYI old implementation
 
 # First build the main section URL
 main_section = context
 main_section_path = None
 #while main_section_path is None and main_section is not None:
 # if hasattr(main_section, 'getPortalType'):
 # if main_section.getPortalType() == 'Web Section':
 # main_section_path = str(main_section.getObject().absolute_url())
 # elif main_section.getPortalType() == 'Web Site':
 # main_section_path = str(main_section.getObject().absolute_url())
 # main_section = main_section.aq_parent
 while hasattr(main_section,'aq_parent'):
 main_section_path = str(main_section.absolute_url())
 main_section = main_section.aq_parent
 
 
 
 # Then get the object
 brain=None
 if brain is None: brain=context
 object = brain.getObject()
 #if object is not None:
 # if object.hasReference():
 # reference = object.getReference()
 # else:
 # reference = None
 #else:
 # return ""
 
 #if reference:
 # return "%s/%s" % (main_section_path, reference)
 
 if context.getPortalType()=="Web Page":
 billl=context.WebSite_getBreadcrumbItemList()
 billl=billl[1][1].WebSite_getDocumentUrl() #get the URL of the section
 context.log("bc",billl)
 return billl+"/"+context.getReference()
 #context.log("hello",context.title+"==>"+context.aq_parent.WebSite_getDocumentUrl()+"--"+context.aq_inner.getUrl()+"--"+context.aq_inner.absolute_url()+"--"+context.aq_parent.absolute_url())
 
 return "%s/%s" % (main_section_path, object.getRelativeUrl())
